sen.j: 山田 顕義（やまだ あきよし、1844年11月18日（天保15年10月9日 (旧暦)） - 1892年11月11日）は、日本の武士（長州藩士）､政治家、陸軍軍人。
sen.e: Akiyoshi YAMADA (November 18,1844-November 11,1892) was a samurai (a feudal retainer of Choshu Domain),statesman and army military man.
Akiyoshi YAMADA (November 18,1844-November 11,1892) was a samurai (a feudal retainer of the Choshu Domain), statesman and army military man.
Akiyoshi YAMADA (November 18,1844-November 11,1892) was a samurai (a feudal retainer of the Choshu Domain), statesman and army military man.

sen.j: 通称は市之允、諱は顕孝、のち顕義と改めた。
sen.e: His common name was Ichinojyo,imina (real name of a man of position) was Akitaka,changed to Akiyoshi later.
His common name was Ichinojyo, imina (real name of a man of position) was Akitaka later changed to Akiyoshi.
His common name was Ichinojyo, imina (real name of a man of position) was Akitaka later changed to Akiyoshi.

sen.j: 位階勲等は陸軍中将・正二位・勲等。
sen.e: His ranks and orders were lieutenant general (army),Shonii (Senior Second Rank),medals for merit.
His ranks and orders were lieutenant general (army), Shonii (Senior Second Rank), medals for merit.
His ranks and orders were lieutenant general (army), Shonii (Senior Second Rank), medals for merit.

sen.j: 爵位は伯爵。
sen.e: His peerage was count.
His peerage was count.
His peerage was count.

sen.j: 近代日本の法典整備に力を尽くし、日本大学（日本法律学校）、國學院大學（学校法人國學院大學）の学祖でもある。
sen.e: He was founder of Nihon University (Nihon Law School) and Kokugakuin University (incorporated educational institution Kokugakuin University),devoting himself to arranging the legal code of modern times Japan.

He was the founder of Nihon University (Nihon Law School) and Kokugakuin University (incorporated educational institution Kokugakuin University), devoting himself to arranging the legal code of modern times in Japan.

He was the founder of Nihon University (Nihon Law School) and Kokugakuin University (incorporated educational institution Kokugakuin University), devoting himself to arranging the legal code of modern times in Japan.

sen.j: 天保15年（1844年）10月9日、当時の長門国阿武郡椿郷東分（山口県萩市）で、長州藩士である山田七兵衛顕行（大組士、禄高102石、藩海軍頭）の長男として生まれる。
sen.e: In October 9,1844,he was born first son to a feudal retainer of Choshu Domain Akiyukishichibei YAMADA (upper-ranked "kuhismi" samurai, rokudaka (stipend),a hea of domain navy) in Higashibun Tsubakigou Abu gun Nagato Province (Hagi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture) of those days.

In October 9,1844, he was born first son to a feudal retainer of the Choshu Domain Akiyukishichibei YAMADA (upper-ranked "kuhismi" samurai, rokudaka (stipend), head of the domain navy) in Higashibun Tsubakigou Abu gun Nagato Province (Hagi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture) in those days.

In November 18, 1844, he was born first son to a feudal retainer of the Choshu Domain Akiyukishichibei YAMADA (upper-ranked "kumishi" samurai, rokudaka (stipend), head of the domain navy) in Higashibun Tsubakigou Abu gun Nagato Province (Hagi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture) in those days.
sen.cmt: spelling, spacingを修正しました。October 9→November 18（グレゴリオ歴に直して文頭の生年月日と合わせました。）

sen.j: 安政3年（1856年）、松本村の新山直衛塾に学ぶ。
sen.e: In 1856,he studied in Naoe NIIYAMA juku in Matsumoto village.
In 1856, he studied in Naoe NIIYAMA juku in Matsumoto village.
In 1856, he studied in Naoe NIIYAMA juku in Matsumoto village.

sen.j: 2月、伯父の山田亦介により、中村九郎と竹内竹叢から兵学を教授される。
sen.e: In February,his uncle Matasuke YAMADA made him learn military science from Kuro NAKAMURA and Takemura TAKEUCHI.
In February, his uncle Matasuke YAMADA made him learn military science from Kuro NAKAMURA and Takemura TAKEUCHI.
In March, his uncle Matasuke YAMADA made him learn military science from Kuro NAKAMURA and Takemura TAKEUCHI.
sen.cmt: OKグレゴリオ歴に変更しました。

sen.j: 3月、藩校明倫館に入って師範の馬木勝平から剣術（柳生新陰流）を学び、文久2年（1862年）には柳生新陰流伝中許を得ている。
sen.e: In March,he entered a Domain school Meirinkan,learning swordplay (Yagyu Shinkage-ryu) under grand master Shohei UMAKI,and he had gotten a license of teaching it.
sen.cmt: 馬木勝平→Shohei UMAKI （定訳不明,該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした。）
sen.e: In March, he entered the Meirinkan Domain school, learning swordplay (Yagyu Shinkage-ryu) under grand master Shohei UMAKI, and received a license to teach it.
In April, he entered the Meirinkan Domain school, learning swordplay (Yagyu Shinkage-ryu) under grand master Shohei UMAKI, and received a license to teach it.
sen.cmt: OKグレゴリオ歴に変更しました。

sen.j: 安政4年（1857年）6月、松下村塾に入門した。
sen.e: In June 1857,he entered Shoka-son juku.
In June 1857, he entered Shoka-son juku.
In July 1857, he entered Shoka-son juku.
sen.cmt: OKグレゴリオ歴に変更しました。

sen.j: 安政5年（1858年）、、吉田松陰から「与山田生」（詩）「立志尚特異 俗流與議難 不思身後業 且偸目前安 百年一瞬耳 君子勿素餐」と立志の目標が書かれた扇面を与えられる。
sen.e: In 1858,he was given a face of fan on which written a song about how to set up an aim in life,saying 'To Yamada' 'Don't be afraid to be different from others if you resolve something,Don't follow the public view,Don't think about the suffering after death,Learn that pleasure is fleeting,100years is only a moment,Please don't waste your time.' by Shoin YOSHIDA.
sen.cmt: 与山田生（定訳不明,正確な意味を見つけることができませんでした。）
sen.e: In 1858, he was given a fan on which written a song about how to find purpose in life, saying 'To Yamada' 'Don't be afraid to be different from others if you resolve something, Don't follow the public view, Don't think about the suffering after death, Learn that pleasure is fleeting, 100years is only a moment, Please don't waste your time.' by Shoin YOSHIDA.

In 1858, he was given a fan on which written a song about how to find purpose in life, saying 'To Yamada' 'Don't be afraid to be different from others if you resolve something, Don't follow the public view, Don't think about the suffering after death, Learn that pleasure is fleeting, 100years is only a moment, Please don't waste your time.' by Shoin YOSHIDA.

sen.j: 幕末期
sen.e: The End of Edo period
The End of the Edo period
The End of the Edo period

sen.j: 文久2年（1862年）秋に上京し、藩主の跡継ぎである毛利定広の警護を務めるようになった。
sen.e: In the fall of 1862,he came up to the capital,serving as a bodyguard of Sadahiro MORI,the successor to the lord of domain.
In the fall of 1862, he went to the capital, serving as a bodyguard of Sadahiro MORI, the successor to the lord of the domain.
In the fall of 1862, he went to the capital, serving as a bodyguard of Sadahiro MORI, the successor to the lord of the domain.

sen.j: 同年12月、高杉晋作、久坂玄瑞、志道聞多（のちの井上馨）、伊藤俊輔（のちの伊藤博文）、品川弥二郎らとともに攘夷の血判書（御楯組血判書）に名を連ねた。
sen.e: In December of the same year,he put his name on the paper with a seal of blood (of Mitate group) swearing the expulsion of foreigners along with Shinsaku TAKASUGI,Genzui KUSAKA,Monta SHIDO (later Kaoru INOUE),Shunsuke ITO (later Hirobumi ITO) and Yajiro SHINAGAWA.

In December of the same year, he put his name on the paper with a seal of blood (of Mitate group) swearing to the expulsion of foreigners along with Shinsaku TAKASUGI, Genzui KUSAKA, Monta SHIDO (later Kaoru INOUE), Shunsuke ITO (later Hirobumi ITO) and Yajiro SHINAGAWA.

In January 1863, he put his name on the paper with a seal of blood (of Mitate group) swearing to the expulsion of foreigners along with Shinsaku TAKASUGI, Genzui KUSAKA, Monta SHIDO (later Kaoru INOUE), Shunsuke ITO (later Hirobumi ITO) and Yajiro SHINAGAWA.
sen.cmt: December of the same yea→January 1863(グレゴリオ歴に変更しました）

sen.j: 文久3年（1863年）3月31日、孝明天皇の攘夷祈願の賀茂神社行幸に際して、御前警護のため毛利定広に随行した。
sen.e: In March 31,1863, when the Emperor Komei went to Kamo-jinja Shrine to pray for the exclusion of foreigners,Akiyoshi attended Sadahiro MORI as a guard in front of the Emperor.
In March 31,1863, when Emperor Komei went to Kamo-jinja Shrine to pray for the exclusion of foreigners, Akiyoshi attended Sadahiro MORI as a guard in front of the Emperor.
In May 18,1863, when Emperor Komei went to Kamo-jinja Shrine to pray for the exclusion of foreigners, Akiyoshi attended Sadahiro MORI as a guard in front of the Emperor.
sen.cmt: March 31→May 18(グレゴリオ歴に変更しました）

sen.j: 同年4月11日の石清水八幡宮への行幸にも同様に随行した。
sen.e: In April of the same year,he also attended the Emperor to Iwashimizu Hachiman-gu Shrine.
In April of the same year, he also attended the Emperor at Iwashimizu Hachiman-gu Shrine.
On May 28 of the same year, he also attended the Emperor at Iwashimizu Hachiman-gu Shrine.
sen.cmt: April →May 28（グレゴリオ歴に変更し、日付が漏れていたので入力しました。）

sen.j: 同年の八月十八日の政変では長州藩兵として堺町御門の警備を担当し大砲掛となるも、公武合体派に排除され、三条実美以下7人の尊皇攘夷派公卿の長州亡命（七卿落ち）に同行した。
sen.e: In Coup of August 18 happened in the same year,he guarded Sakaimachigomon as a samurai of the Choshu clan,charging a cannon,but cleared off by Kobu Gattai ha(supporters of the doctrine of unity between the Bakufu and the imperial court),he went along with Sanetomi SANJO and other 7 Kugyo (high court noble) of Sonno Joi ha (supporters of the doctorine of restoring the emperor and expelling the barbarians) in their Choshu exile (the exile of the Seven nobles from Kyoto).

In the Coup of August 18 that happened in the same year, he guarded Sakaimachigomon as a samurai of the Choshu clan, charging a cannon, but cleared off by Kobu Gattai ha (supporters of the doctrine of unity between the Bakufu and the imperial court), he went along with Sanetomi SANJO and other seven Kugyo (high court noble) of Sonno Joi ha (supporters of the doctorine of restoring the emperor and expelling the barbarians) in their Choshu exile (the exile of the Seven nobles from Kyoto).

In the Coup of August 18 that happened in the same year, he guarded Sakaimachigomon as a samurai of the Choshu clan, charging a cannon, but cleared off by Kobu Gattai ha (supporters of the doctrine of unity between the Bakufu and the imperial court), he went along with Sanetomi SANJO and other seven Kugyo (high court noble) of Sonno Joi ha (supporters of the doctorine of restoring the emperor and expelling the barbarians) in their Choshu exile (the exile of the Seven nobles from Kyoto).

sen.j: しかし途中で兵庫から大坂経由で京都へ一旦戻り潜伏。
sen.e: However,he returned to Kyoto from Hyogo on the way,by way of Osaka,hiding away for a while.
However,he returned to Kyoto from Hyogo on the way, by way of Osaka, hiding away for a while.
However,he returned to Kyoto from Hyogo on the way, by way of Osaka, hiding away for a while.

sen.j: 後に長州へ帰国した。
sen.e: Then,later returned to Choshu.
Then,later returned to Choshu.
Then, later returned to Choshu.

sen.j: 藩から遊撃隊御用掛に任命された。
sen.e: The Domain assigned him as a commando unit.
The Domain assigned him to a commando unit.
The Domain assigned him to a commando unit.

sen.j: 普門寺塾で大村益次郎から西洋兵学を学んだ。
sen.e: He learned Western military science under Masujiro OMURA in Fumon-ji juku.
He learned Western military science under Masujiro OMURA in Fumon-ji juku.
He learned Western military science under Masujiro OMURA in Fumon-ji juku.

sen.j: 元治元年（1864年）、禁門の変では山崎に布陣する久坂玄瑞、真木和泉らの陣に加わったものの長州勢は敗北し、山田も長州へ落ち延びている。
sen.e: In 1864,he joined the camp of Genzui KUSAKA and Izumi MAKI,which was lining up at Yamazaki,in Kinmon Incident,and Yamada escaped to Choshu with them,as the Choshu army was beaten.
In 1864,he joined the camp of Genzui KUSAKA and Izumi MAKI, which was lining up at Yamazaki,in Kinmon Incident, and Yamada escaped to Choshu with them, as the Choshu army was beaten.
In 1864, he joined the camp of Genzui KUSAKA and Izumi MAKI, which was lining up at Yamazaki, in Kinmon Incident, and Yamada escaped to Choshu with them, as the Choshu army was beaten.

sen.j: 同年8月、大田市之進、品川弥二郎らと御楯隊を創設し、軍監となって下関戦争で奮戦するも長州藩は敗北した。
sen.e: In August of the same year,he formed the Mitate party with Ichinoshin ODA and Yajiro SHINAGAWA,fighting hard in Shimonoseki War as Assitant Deputy General,however,Choshu Domain was defeated.

In August of the same year, he formed the Mitate party with Ichinoshin ODA and Yajiro SHINAGAWA, fighting hard in the Shimonoseki War as Assitant Deputy General, however, the Choshu Domain was defeated.

In September of the same year, he formed the Mitate party with Ichinoshin ODA and Yajiro SHINAGAWA, fighting hard in the Shimonoseki War as Assitant Deputy General, however, the Choshu Domain was defeated.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更しました。

sen.j: 同年12月、対幕府恭順論の「俗論派」による藩支配に対する高杉晋作の決起に参戦し勝利を収め、「俗論派」を排除する。
sen.e: In December of the same year,he joined Shinsaku TAKASUGI,who rose up to fight against 'conventional party' which was supporting the doctorine of allegiance to Bakufu and ruling the Domain,defeating and removing them.

During December of the same year, he joined Shinsaku TAKASUGI, who rose up to fight against 'conventional party' which was supporting the doctorine of allegiance to Bakufu and ruling the Domain, defeating and removing them.

During December of the same year, he joined Shinsaku TAKASUGI, who rose up to fight against 'conventional party' which was supporting the doctorine of allegiance to Bakufu and ruling the Domain, defeating and removing them.

sen.j: 慶応2年（1866年）、第二次長州征伐では藩海軍総督の高杉晋作から丙寅丸の砲隊長に任命され、同年6月、周防大島沖で幕府軍艦を奇襲攻撃。
sen.e: In 1866,he was appointed as a head of cannon party of Yang Fire Tiger Maru by Shinsaku TAKASUGI,governor of the Domain navy,in Second conquest of Choshu,making a surprise attack on the warship of Bakufu in June of the same year.

In 1866, he was appointed as a head of the cannon party of Yang Fire Tiger Maru by Shinsaku TAKASUGI, governor of the Domain navy, in Second conquest of Choshu, making a surprise attack on the warship of Bakufu in June of the same year.

In 1866, he was appointed as a head of the cannon party of Yang Fire Tiger Maru by Shinsaku TAKASUGI, governor of the Domain navy, in Second conquest of Choshu, making a surprise attack on the warship of Bakufu in June of the same year.
sen.cmt: June →July（グレゴリオ歴に変更しました）

sen.j: 同年7月、御楯隊司令として芸州口に転戦、数々の勝利を収めた。
sen.e: In July of the same year,he moved from place to place to fight,heading to Geishukuchi as a commander of the Mitate party,winning many battles.
In July of the same year, he moved from place to place to fight, heading to Geishukuchi as a commander of the Mitate party,vwinning many battles.
In August of the same year, he moved from place to place to fight, heading to Geishukuchi as a commander of the Mitate party, winning many battles.
sen.cmt: spellingを修正しました。グレゴリオ歴に変更しました

sen.j: なお、同年7月20日に将軍徳川家茂の死去により第二次長州征伐は休戦となった。
sen.e: And in July 20 of the same year,Second conquest of Choshu was aborted due to the death of Shogun Iemochi TOKUGAWA.
And on July 20 of the same year, a second conquest of Choshu was aborted due to the death of Shogun Iemochi TOKUGAWA.
And on August 29 of the same year, a second conquest of Choshu was aborted due to the death of Shogun Iemochi TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更しました

sen.j: 慶応3年（1867年）5月、御楯隊と鴻城隊を合体した整武隊の総管に就任。
sen.e: In May 1867,he assumed Soukan of the Seibu party,which was a coalition of the Mitate party and the Koujyou party.
In May 1867, he assumed Soukan of the Seibu party, which was a coalition of the Mitate party and the Koujyou party.
In June 1867, he assumed Sokan (director) of the Seibu party, which was a coalition of the Mitate party and the Koujo party.
sen.cmt: spellingを修正しました。グレゴリオ歴に変更しました

sen.j: 同年11月、薩摩藩から倒幕運動の出兵要請を受けた藩主毛利敬親の命令で、全軍総督である毛利内匠の東征軍先鋒隊700人余とともに海路で京都に入った。
sen.e: In December of the same year,he went into Kyoto by sea along with some 700 people of the spearhead convoy of the expeditionary force to the east,which was under Takumi MOURI, governor of all the army,ordered by the lord of domain Takachika MORI,who had been requested by Satsuma Domain to dispatch the troops for the movement to overthrow the Shogunate.

In December of the same year,he went into Kyoto by sea along with some 700 people in the spearhead convoy of the expeditionary force to the east, which was under Takumi MOURI, governor of all the army, ordered by the lord of domain Takachika MORI, who had been requested by the Satsuma Domain to dispatch the troops for the movement to overthrow the Shogunate.

In December of the same year,he went into Kyoto by sea along with some 700 people in the spearhead convoy of the expeditionary force to the east, which was under Takumi MOURI, governor of all the army, ordered by the lord of domain Takachika MORI, who had been requested by the Satsuma Domain to dispatch the troops for the movement to overthrow the Shogunate.

sen.j: 慶応4年（1868年）1月、鳥羽・伏見の戦いにおいて、新政府・仁和寺宮嘉彰征討総督の副参謀に任命される。
sen.e: In January,1868,he was assigned as vice general staff of Yoshiakira NINNAJINOMIYA,the governor-general of suppression of a new government,in Toba-Fushimi War.
In January, 1868,he was assigned as vice general staff of Yoshiakira NINNAJINOMIYA, the governor-general of suppression of a new government, in Toba-Fushimi War.
In January, 1868, he was assigned as vice general staff of Yoshiakira NINNAJINOMIYA, the governor-general of suppression of a new government, in Toba-Fushimi War.

sen.j: 陸軍参謀兼海陸軍参謀として官軍を率い、戊辰戦争や箱館戦争で勝利した。
sen.e: He won victories in Boshin War and Battle of Hakodate,leading the Imperial army as general staff of the army and of the navy and army.
He won victories in the Boshin War and the Battle of Hakodate, leading the Imperial army as general staff of the army and of the navy and army.
He won victories in the Boshin War and the Battle of Hakodate, leading the Imperial army as general staff of the army and of the navy and army.

sen.j: 明治2年（1869年）6月、宮中において黒田清隆参謀らとともに天皇に謁見、戦功を賞される。
sen.e: In June,1869,he was awarded for his distinguished war service,granted audiences by the Emperor along with Kiyotaka KURODA in Imperial court.
In June, 1869, he was awarded for his distinguished war service, granted audiences by the Emperor along with Kiyotaka KURODA in the Imperial court.
In July, 1869, he was awarded for his distinguished war service, granted audiences by the Emperor along with Kiyotaka KURODA in the Imperial court.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更しました

sen.j: 陸海軍参謀の任を解かれ、新官制（太政官制）施行による兵部大丞に就任。
sen.e: He assumed as official of national defense as the new government-regulated organization (System of Departments of State) came into effect,dismissed from the position of vice general staff of the army and navy.

He assumed the position of official of national defense as the new government-regulated organization (System of Departments of State) came into effect, dismissed from the position of vice general staff of the army and navy.

He assumed the position of official of national defense as the new government-regulated organization (System of Departments of State) came into effect, dismissed from the position of vice general staff of the army and navy.

sen.j: 長州藩少参事兼任を命ぜられる。
sen.e: He also was assigned concurrently as junior secretary of Choshu Domain.
sen.cmt: 少参事→junior secretary (定訳不明でした。）
sen.e: He also was assigned concurrently as junior secretary of the Choshu Domain.
He also was assigned concurrently as junior secretary of the Choshu Domain.

sen.j: 8月、山口凱旋。
sen.e: In August,he returned to Yamaguchi with glory.
In August, he returned to Yamaguchi with glory.
In September, he returned to Yamaguchi with glory.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更しました

sen.j: 顕義と改名。
sen.e: He changed his name to Akiyoshi.
He changed his name to Akiyoshi.
He changed his name to Akiyoshi.

sen.j: 同年9月、維新の軍功により新政府から永世600石の禄を下賜される。
sen.e: In September of the same year,he was granted permanent 600koku as compensation for his military glory in Meiji Restoration.
In September of the same year, he was permanently granted 600 koku as compensation for his military glory during the Meiji Restoration.
In October of the same year, he was permanently granted 600 koku as compensation for his military glory during the Meiji Restoration.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更しました

sen.j: しかし、大村益次郎の暗殺未遂により、藩命で急ぎ上京。
sen.e: However,he came up to the capital immediately by command of domain due to the assassination attempt of Masujiro OMURA.
However, he immediately went to the capital by commanded by the domain due to the assassination attempt of Masujiro OMURA.
However, he immediately went to the capital commanded by the domain due to the assassination attempt of Masujiro OMURA.

sen.j: 病床の大村より日本近代軍制の創設について指示を受け、11月には兵部少輔久我通久と連署で大村の遺策をまとめた『兵部省軍務ノ大綱』を太政官に提出。
sen.e: He received instruction about founding of Japanese modern times military system from ailing Omura,submitting Outline of the responsibilities of the Ministry of the Military,in which he organized the plan Omura had left behind,cosigning with Michitsune KOGA, Hyobu-shoyu (junior assistant minister of the Hyobusho Ministry of Military),to Departments of State in November.

He received instructions concerning the founding of the Japanese modern military system from ailing Omura, submitting an Outline of the responsibilities of the Ministry of the Military, in which he organized the plan Omura had left behind, cosigning with Michitsune KOGA, Hyobu-shoyu (junior assistant minister of the Hyobusho Ministry of Military), to Departments of State in November.

He received instructions concerning the founding of the Japanese modern military system from ailing Omura, submitting an Outline of the responsibilities of the Ministry of the Military, in which he organized the plan Omura had left behind, cosigning with Michitsune KOGA, Hyobu-shoyu (junior assistant minister of the Hyobusho Ministry of Military), to Departments of State in December.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更しました

sen.j: 大村の継承者として大坂を中心とした兵部省確立に尽力する。
sen.e: He made an effort to establish Hyobusho (ministry of military) centering on Osaka as a successor to Omura.
He made an effort to establish Hyobusho (ministry of military) centering on Osaka as a successor to Omura.
He made an effort to establish Hyobusho (ministry of military) centering on Osaka as a successor to Omura.

sen.j: 明治3年（1870年）、大村の計画に従い、大坂城跡に設置された大坂兵部省出張所と東京の本省とを往復する日々を過ごす。
sen.e: In 1870,he spend days travelling back and forth between Osaka Hyobusho (ministry of military) branch office constructed in Osaka-jo Castle ruins and head office in Tokyo,on Omura's plan.

In 1870, he spent his days travelling back and forth between Osaka Hyobusho (ministry of the military) branch office constructed in Osaka-jo Castle ruins and the head office in Tokyo, on Omura's plan.

In 1870, he spent his days travelling back and forth between Osaka Hyobusho (ministry of the military) branch office constructed in Osaka-jo Castle ruins and the head office in Tokyo, on Omura's plan.

sen.j: 5月頃から畿内限定の徴兵制（辛未徴兵）施行の政府有力者に働き掛けを開始する。
sen.e: Around May,he started appealing to influential person in politics who were in charge of implementation of conscription (Shinbi draft) restricted to Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto).

Around May,he started appealing to influential person in politics who were in charge of implementation of conscription (Shinbi draft) restricted to Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto).

Around May, he started appealing to influential person in politics who were in charge of implementation of conscription (Shinbi draft) restricted to Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto).

sen.j: これも大村の計画によるものであった。
sen.e: Which was also Omura's plan.
Which was also Omura's plan.
Which was also Omura's plan.

sen.j: 9月には普仏戦争の観戦を強く希望するが、川村純義等他の兵部省員等も希望した為、省務の停滞を危惧した大久保利通等の指示により許可されなかった。
sen.e: In September,he strongly wanted to watch the Franco-Prussian War,denied by Toshimichi OKUBO and others who were concerned about interruption in ministry work because Sumiyoshi KAWAMURA and other members of Hyobusho (ministry of military) also wanted to.

In September, he strongly wanted to watch the Franco-Prussian War, denied by Toshimichi OKUBO and others who were concerned about interruption in ministry work because Sumiyoshi KAWAMURA and other members of Hyobusho (ministry of military) also wanted to.

In September, he strongly wanted to watch the Franco-Prussian War, denied by Toshimichi OKUBO and others who were concerned about interruption in ministry work because Sumiyoshi KAWAMURA and other members of Hyobusho (ministry of military) also wanted to.

sen.j: この年、大蔵大丞井上馨の養女、湯田温泉瓦屋の鹿島屋喜右衛門の長女龍子と結婚。
sen.e: In the same year,he married Tatsuko who was the first daughter of Kiemon KASHIMAYA of Yuda onsen (hot spring) Kawaraya and also the adopted daughter of Kaoru INOUE,Okura taijo (Senior Secretary of the Minister of the Treasury).

In the same year, he married Tatsuko who was the first daughter of Kiemon KASHIMAYA of Yuda onsen (hot spring) Kawaraya and also the adopted daughter of Kaoru INOUE, Okura taijo (Senior Secretary of the Minister of the Treasury).

In the same year, he married Tatsuko who was the first daughter of Kiemon KASHIMAYA of Yuda onsen (hot spring) Kawaraya and also the adopted daughter of Kaoru INOUE, Okura taijo (Senior Secretary of the Minister of the Treasury).

sen.j: 明治4年（1871年）1月、大坂にて辛未徴兵を開始するも、5月には事実上延期となる（実際には8月まで募兵は続いている）。
sen.e: In January,1871,even though he started Shinbi draft in Osaka,it was practically postponed in May(conscription continued until August in reality).
In January, 1871, even though he started the Shinbi draft in Osaka, it was postponed in May (conscription continued until August in reality).
In February, 1871, even though he started the Shinbi draft in Osaka, it was postponed in May (conscription continued until August in reality).
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更しました。

sen.j: これは徴兵の質及び、指導士官や施設の不足等の根本的な問題の為だった。
sen.e: Which was due to poor quality of conscription and fundamental problems such as lack of training officers or facilities.
Which was due to poor quality of conscription and fundamental problems such as lack of training officers or facilities.
Which was due to poor quality of conscription and fundamental problems such as lack of training officers or facilities.

sen.j: 7月、陸軍少将に任ぜられ、兵部大丞を解かれ兵部省付きとなるが、その理由は不透明。
sen.e: In July,he was assigned as Army Major General attending Hyobusho (ministry of military),dismissed from Hyobu taijo (Senior Secretary of the Ministry of War),which reason is unclear.
In July, he was assigned as Army Major General attending Hyobusho (ministry of the military), dismissed from Hyobu taijo (Senior Secretary of the Ministry of War), for reasons unclear.
In August, he was assigned as Army Major General attending Hyobusho (ministry of the military), dismissed from Hyobu taijo (Senior Secretary of the Ministry of War), for reasons unclear.
sen.cmt: spacingを修正しました。グレゴリオ歴に変更しました。

sen.j: 同年10月、右大臣岩倉具視欧米使節団に兵部省理事官として随行。
sen.e: In October of the same year,he attended Europe and America delegates of Tomomi IWAKURA, Minister of the Right as resident of Hyobusho (ministry of military).
In October of the same year, he attended to Europe and American delegates of Tomomi IWAKURA, Minister of the Right as resident of Hyobusho (ministry of military).
In November of the same year, he attended to Europe and American delegates of Tomomi IWAKURA, Minister of the Right as resident of Hyobusho (ministry of military).
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更しました。

sen.j: サンフランシスコ、ソルトレイクシティ、シカゴを経由し、ワシントンD.C.に到着。
sen.e: He reached Washington,D.C. by way of San Francisco,Salt Lake City and Chicago.
He reached Washington, D.C. by way of San Francisco, Salt Lake City and Chicago.
He reached Washington, D.C. by way of San Francisco, Salt Lake City and Chicago.

sen.j: 明治5年2月（1872年3月）、兵部省一行（原田一道・富永冬樹・岩下長十郎・松村文亮）とともに岩倉らと別れ、フィラデルフィアの海軍施設等を見学後、渡仏。
sen.e: In March 1872,he parted from Iwakura and others with party of Hyobusho (ministry of military) (Ichido HARADA,Fuyuki TOMINAGA,Choujyurou IWASHITA,Fumisuke MATSUMURA),going to France after visiting the navy facilities in Philadelphia.

In March 1872, he parted from Iwakura and others with a party of Hyobusho (ministry of the military) (Ichido HARADA, Fuyuki TOMINAGA, Choujyurou IWASHITA,Fumisuke MATSUMURA), going to France after visiting navy facilities in Philadelphia.

In March 1872, he parted from Iwakura and others with a party of Hyobusho (ministry of the military) (Ichido HARADA, Fuyuki TOMINAGA, Choujyurou IWASHITA,Fumisuke MATSUMURA), going to France after visiting navy facilities in Philadelphia.

sen.j: パリを中心に、ベルリン、オランダ、ベルギー、ローザンヌ、ブルガリア、ロシア等欧州各国で軍制を調査。
sen.e: He inspected military systems in European countries such as Berlin,the Netherlands,Belgium,Lausanne,Bulgaria and Russia,focusing on Paris.
He inspected military systems in European countries such as Berlin, the Netherlands, Belgium, Lausanne, Bulgaria and Russia, focusing on Paris.
He inspected military systems in European countries such as Berlin, the Netherlands, Belgium, Lausanne, Bulgaria and Russia, focusing on Paris.

sen.j: 欧州ではフランスに軍事留学生の渡正元、太田徳三郎がそれぞれ協力した。
sen.e: He was cooperated by Masamoto WATARI,military overseas student in France,and Tokusaburou OOTA respectively.
He received the cooperation of Masamoto WATARI, military overseas student in France, and Tokusaburou OOTA respectively.
He received the cooperation of Masamoto WATARI, military overseas student in France, and Tokusaburou OTA respectively.

sen.j: 山田の欧州での活動についての全貌は詳らかではない。
sen.e: All the details of Yamada's work in Europe are not clear.
All the details of Yamada's work in Europe are not clear.
All the details of Yamada's work in Europe are not clear.

sen.j: ウィーン万国博覧会にも立ち寄り、明治6年（1873年）5月、マルセイユ港から帰途に着く。
sen.e: In May 1873,he left for home from Marseilles harvor,having stopped at world exposition in Vienna.
In May 1873, he left for home from Marseilles harbor, having stopped at the world exposition in Vienna.
In May 1873, he left for home from Marseilles harbor, having stopped at the world exposition in Vienna.

sen.j: 明治6年（1873年）6月、帰国。
sen.e: He returned home in June 1873.
He returned home in June 1873.
He returned home in June 1873.

sen.j: 9月、「兵は凶器なり」と指摘した上申書（理事官功程）提出、自身が遊学中に施行された徴兵令の延期を求めた。
sen.e: In September,he demanded postponement of Conscription Ordinance implemented during his traveling to study,submitting a report (on education of foreign countries),which indicated 'soldiers are lethal weapons'.

In September, he demanded postponement of the Conscription Ordinance implemented during his travels to study, submitting a report (on education in foreign countries), which indicated 'soldiers are lethal weapons'.

In September, he demanded postponement of the Conscription Ordinance implemented during his travels to study, submitting a report (on education in foreign countries), which indicated 'soldiers are lethal weapons'.

sen.j: 7月、東京鎮台司令長官に任命されるが、11月には同職を解かれ清国特命全権公使に任命される。
sen.e: In July,he was assigned as Commander Admiral of Tokyo chindai (garrison in Meiji era),and as envoy extraordinary of Qing in November,dismissed from the former.
In July, he was assigned as Commander Admiral of Tokyo chindai (garrison in Meiji era), and as envoy extraordinary of Qing in November, dismissed from the former.
In July, he was assigned as Commander Admiral of Tokyo chindai (garrison in the Meiji period), and as envoy extraordinary of Qing in November, dismissed from the former.

sen.j: 山田本人に渡清の意思はなく、木戸孝允も大久保利通に対して同職の解任の働き掛けをしている。
sen.e: Yamada had no intention to go Qing himself,and Takayoshi KIDO appealed Yamada's dismissal from envoy extraordinary of Qing to Toshimichi OKUBO.
Yamada had no intention to go Qing himself, and Takayoshi KIDO appealed Yamada's dismissal from envoy extraordinary of Qing to Toshimichi OKUBO.
Yamada had no intention to go to Qing himself, and Takayoshi KIDO appealed Yamada's dismissal from envoy extraordinary of Qing to Toshimichi OKUBO.

sen.j: しかし、清国駐在に至る前の明治7年（1874年）2月、佐賀の乱が勃発し、同職を解かれ、乱鎮圧のため九州出張。
sen.e: However,in February 1874,before he came to reside in Qing,he was dismissed from envoy extraordinary of Qing due to the outbreak of Saga War,travelling to Kyushu to suppress the war.
However, in February 1874, before he came to reside in Qing, he was dismissed from the extraordinary envoy of Qing due to the outbreak of the Saga War, travelling to Kyushu to suppress the war.
However, in February 1874, before he came to reside in Qing, he was dismissed from the extraordinary envoy of Qing due to the outbreak of the Saga War, travelling to Kyushu to suppress the war.

sen.j: 乱は翌3月に平定。
sen.e: In March of the following year,the war was suppressed.
In March of the following year, the war was suppressed.
In March of the following year, the war was suppressed.

sen.j: 同年7月、佐賀の乱鎮圧の戦功を賞され、一方で伊藤博文等の説得により、現役陸軍少将のまま司法大輔に就任。
sen.e: In July of the same year,he assumed as Shiho-taifu (post of Ministry of Justice) while continuing as Army Major General,persuaded by Hirobumi ITO,awarded for distinguished war service in Saga War at the same time.

In July of the same year, he assumed Shiho-taifu (post as Ministry of Justice) while continuing as Army Major General, persuaded by Hirobumi ITO, and awarded for distinguished war service in Saga War at the same time.

In July of the same year, he assumed Shiho-taifu (post as Ministry of Justice) while continuing as Army Major General, persuaded by Hirobumi ITO, and awarded for distinguished war service in Saga War at the same time.

sen.j: 帰国以来、山縣有朋と徴兵令施行等の意見衝突によって対立していた山田は陸軍少将の肩書きのみで陸軍に実質的な地位はなく、政府内で微妙な立場にあった為、方向転換せざるをえなかった。
sen.e: Yamada was in a tenuous position in the government,having no actual status but a title of Army Major General due to his confrontation between Aritomo YAMAGATA over implementation of Conscription Ordinance since he returned home,which forced him to change his direction.

Yamada was in a tenuous position in the government, having no actual status, except the title of Army Major General due to his confrontation between Aritomo YAMAGATA over implementation of the Conscription Ordinance since he returned home, which forced him to change direction.

Yamada was in a tenuous position in the government, having no actual status, except the title of Army Major General due to his confrontation between Aritomo YAMAGATA over implementation of the Conscription Ordinance since he returned home, which forced him to change direction.

sen.j: 明治8年（1875年）9月、刑法編纂委員長に就任。
sen.e: In September 1875,he assumed as Chairman of Penal Code compilation.
In September 1875, he assumed the position as Chairman of Penal Code compilation.
In September 1875, he assumed the position as Chairman of Penal Code compilation.

sen.j: 明治9年（1876年）7月頃には、後に洋館を建てる文京区音羽の土地は購入していたらしい。
sen.e: It appears he had bought a parcel of land of Otowa Bunkyo-ku Ward,on which he built a Western-style house later,before July 1876.
It appears he bought a parcel of land of Otowa Bunkyo-ku Ward, on which he built a Western-style house later, before July 1876.
It appears he bought a parcel of land of Otowa Bunkyo-ku Ward, on which he built a Western-style house later, before July 1876.

sen.j: （山田邸は東京大空襲で焼失し、現在は講談社が建っている）
sen.e: (The house of Yamada was burned down by Great Tokyo Air Raids and there is a building of Kodansha Ltd. now.)
(The house of Yamada was burned down by the Great Tokyo Air Raids and now there is a building of Kodansha Ltd. standing in it's place.)
(The house of Yamada was burned down by the Great Tokyo Air Raids and now there is a building of Kodansha Ltd. standing in it's place.)

sen.j: 明治10年（1877年）3月、西南戦争勃発により、司法大輔を辞職する覚悟で単身京都に出張し、鎮圧出征を懇願する。
sen.e: In March 1877,as Seinan War broke out,he went to Kyoto by himself,preparing to resign from Shiho-taifu (post of Ministry of Justice),and appealed for departure for the front to suppress it.
In March 1877, as the Seinan War broke out, he went to Kyoto by himself, preparing to resign from Shiho-taifu (post of Ministry of Justice), and appealed for departure for the front to suppress it.
In March 1877, as the Seinan War broke out, he went to Kyoto by himself, preparing to resign from Shiho-taifu (post of Ministry of Justice), and appealed for departure for the front to suppress it.

sen.j: 木戸孝允等の協力の末、別働第二旅団長として出征を命ぜられる。
sen.e: He was ordered to depart for the front as leader of Betsudo-Daini-ryodan (the second stand-alone brigade),having been cooperated by Takayoshi KIDO and others.
He was ordered to depart for the front as leader of Betsudo-Daini-ryodan (the second stand-alone brigade), having received the cooperation of Takayoshi KIDO and others.
He was ordered to depart for the front as leader of Betsudo-Daini-ryodan (the second stand-alone brigade), having received the cooperation of Takayoshi KIDO and others.

sen.j: 同年9月、西南戦争終結し、同年11月、戦功によって勲二等を賜る。
sen.e: In September of the same year,Seinan War was over and in November,he was awarded Order of Second Class for his distinguished war service.
In September of the same year, the Seinan War was over and in November, he was awarded the Order of Second Class for his distinguished war service.
In September of the same year, the Seinan War was over and in November, he was awarded the Order of Second Class for his distinguished war service.

sen.j: 明治11年（1878年）2月、刑法草案審査委員として法典編纂に従事。
sen.e: In February 1878,he was engaged on compiling code of law as a member of Penal Code draft reviewing committee.
In February 1878, he was engaged on compiling a code of law as a member of Penal Code draft reviewing committee.
In February 1878, he was engaged on compiling a code of law as a member of Penal Code draft reviewing committee.

sen.j: 同年11月、陸軍中将に任ぜられる。
sen.e: In November of the same year,he was assigned as Army Lieutenant General.
In November of the same year, he was assigned as Army Lieutenant General.
In November of the same year, he was assigned as Army Lieutenant General.

sen.j: 明治12年（1879年）7月、長男金吉誕生。
sen.e: In December 1879,his first son Kaneyoshi was born.
sen.cmt: 金吉→Kaneyoshi（定訳不明,該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした。）
sen.e: In December 1879, his first son Kaneyoshi was born.
In December 1879, his first son Kaneyoshi was born.

sen.j: 9月、参議兼工部卿に任ぜられる。
sen.e: In September,he was assigned as Sangi (councillor) and Koubukyou (head of Koubu Department) at the same time.
In September, he was assigned as Sangi (councillor) and Koubukyou (head of Koubu Department) at the same time.
In September, he was assigned as Sangi (councillor) and Koubukyo (head of Koubu Department) at the same time.

sen.j: 11月、工部大学校第一回卒業式で卒業生一人一人に証書を手渡す。
sen.e: In November,he handed graduation certificates to each and every one of graduates in the first graduation ceremony at the Imperial College of Engineering.
In November, he handed graduation certificates to each and every one of graduates in the first graduation ceremony at the Imperial College of Engineering.
In November, he handed graduation certificates to each and every one of graduates in the first graduation ceremony at the Imperial College of Engineering.

sen.j: 明治13年（1880年）2月、専任参議に任ぜられる。
sen.e: In February 1880,he was assigned as full-time Sangi (councilor).
In February 1880, he was assigned as full-time Sangi (councilor).
In February 1880, he was assigned as full-time Sangi (councilor).

sen.j: 3月、長男金吉死亡。
sen.e: In March,his first son Kaneyoshi died.
In March, his first son Kaneyoshi died.
In March, his first son Kaneyoshi died.

sen.j: 6月、憲法意見書を提出。
sen.e: In June,he submitted a written opinion of the constitution.
In June, he submitted a written opinion on the constitution.
In June, he submitted a written opinion on the constitution.

sen.j: 明治14年（1881年）8、9月頃、独自の憲法草案である「憲法私案」を左大臣有栖川宮熾仁親王に呈し、さらに改定したものを右大臣岩倉具視に呈す。
sen.e: Around August or September of 1881,he showed his original draft constitution "A modest proposal constitution" to Taruhitoshinnou ARISUGAWANOMIYA,Minister of the Left,and the revised one to Tomomi IWAKURA, Minister of the Right.

Around August or September of 1881, he showed his original draft of the constitution "A modest proposal constitution" to Taruhitoshinnou ARISUGAWANOMIYA, Minister of the Left, and the revised one to Tomomi IWAKURA, Minister of the Right.

Around August or September of 1881, he showed his original draft of the constitution "A personal proposal constitution" to Taruhitoshinnou ARISUGAWANOMIYA, Minister of the Left, and the revised one to Tomomi IWAKURA, Minister of the Right.

sen.j: 同年10月、参議兼内務卿に就任。
sen.e: In October of the same year,he assumed concurrently as Sangi (councilor) and Secretary of Interior.
In October of the same year, he concurrently assumed the position of Sangi (councilor) and Secretary of Interior.
In October of the same year, he concurrently assumed the position of Sangi (councilor) and Secretary of Interior.

sen.j: 明治16年（1883年）4月、東京府知事芳川顕正に対し、衛生上の理由から、東京府においても下水道改良整備を示達。
sen.e: In April 1883,he ordered the improvement of sewerage systems also in Tokyo to Yoshimasa AKIKAWA, the Governor of Tokyo Prefecture,for hygiene reasons.
In April 1883, he ordered the improvement of sewer systems also in Tokyo to Yoshimasa AKIKAWA, the Governor of Tokyo Prefecture, for the reason of hygiene.
In April 1883, he ordered the improvement of sewer systems also in Tokyo to Yoshimasa AKIKAWA, the Governor of Tokyo Prefecture, for the reason of hygiene.

sen.j: 司法卿。
sen.e: Shihokyo (administrator of Ministry of Justice).
Shihokyo (administrator of the Ministry of Justice).
Shihokyo (administrator of the Ministry of Justice).

sen.j: 同年12月、内務卿を辞任し、司法卿兼参議に就任。
sen.e: In December of the same year,he resigned from Secretary of Interior and assumed concurrently as Shihokyo (administrator of Ministry of Justice) and Sangi (councilor).
In December of the same year, he resigned as Secretary of Interior and concurrently assumed the position of Shihokyo (administrator of Ministry of Justice) and Sangi (councilor).
In December of the same year, he resigned as Secretary of Interior and concurrently assumed the position of Shihokyo (administrator of Ministry of Justice) and Sangi (councilor).

sen.j: 明治17年（1884年）、伯爵を受爵。
sen.e: In 1884,he was titled as count.
In 1884, he was given the title of count.
In 1884, he was given the title of count.

sen.j: 明治18年（1885年）12月、内閣制度発足、第1次伊藤内閣の司法大臣（初代）に就任。
sen.e: In December 1885,as the cabinet system was inaugurated,he assumed as the first Minister of Justice in The First Ito Cabinet.
In December 1885, as the cabinet system was inaugurated, he assumed the post as the first Minister of Justice in The First Ito Cabinet.
In December 1885, as the cabinet system was inaugurated, he assumed the post as the first Minister of Justice in The First Ito Cabinet.

sen.j: 以後、第1次松方内閣まで同職を務める。
sen.e: After which,he served as Minister of Justice until The First Matsukata cabinet.
After which, he served as the Minister of Justice until The First Matsukata cabinet.
After which, he served as the Minister of Justice until The First Matsukata cabinet.

sen.j: 明治20年（1887年）、大日本私立衛生会会頭に就任。
sen.e: In 1887,he assumed as the head of Dai-Nihon Shiritsu Eisei-Kai (Japan private hygiene society).
sen.cmt: 大日本私立衛生会(定訳不明でした。)
sen.e: In 1887, he assumed the position as the head of the Dai-Nihon Shiritsu Eisei-Kai (Japan private hygiene society).
In 1887, he assumed the position as the head of the Dai-Nihon Shiritsu Eisei-Kai (Japan private hygiene society).

sen.j: 同年10月、法律取調委員長に就任し、民法・商法・訴訟法の編纂事業に貢献。
sen.e: In October of the same year,he assumed as the head of Law investigating,contributing to compilation of Civil Code,Commercial Code and Code of Criminal Procedure.
In October of the same year, he assumed the position as the head of Law investigating, contributing to compilation of Civil Code, Commercial Code and the Code of Criminal Procedure.
In October of the same year, he assumed the position as the head of Law investigating, contributing to compilation of Civil Code, Commercial Code and the Code of Criminal Procedure.

sen.j: 明治21年（1888年）4月、黒田内閣の司法大臣に就任。
sen.e: In April 1888,he assumed as Minister of Justice in the Kuroda Cabinet.
In April 1888, he assumed the position as Minister of Justice in the Kuroda Cabinet.
In April 1888, he assumed the position as Minister of Justice in the Kuroda Cabinet.

sen.j: 12月、民法典、商法典の各法案を黒田清隆総理大臣及び内閣に提出（明治23年（1890年）4月、民法中の財産編・財産取得編・債権担保編・証拠編、民事訴訟が公布。
sen.e: In December,he submitted draft law of Minpoten (legal code provides for basic stipulation related to Civil Code) and Commercial Legal Code to prime minister Kiyotaka KURODA and the Cabinet,and in April 1890,property part,acquisition of property part,security for an obligation part and evidence part of Civil Code and civil action were issued.

In December, he submitted a draft of law of Minpoten (legal code provides for basic stipulation related to Civil Code) and the Commercial Legal Code to prime minister Kiyotaka KURODA and the Cabinet, and in April 1890, property part, acquisition of property part, security for an obligation part and evidence part of the Civil Code and civil action were issued.

In December, he submitted a draft of law of Minpoten (legal code provides for basic stipulation related to Civil Code) and the Commercial Legal Code to prime minister Kiyotaka KURODA and the Cabinet, and in April 1890, property part, acquisition of property part, security for an obligation part and evidence part of the Civil Code and civil action were issued.

sen.j: 同年10月、民法人事編・財産取得編中贈与・遺贈・夫婦・財産契約が公布。
sen.e: In October of the same year,personnel affairs part of Civil Code,donation of acquisition of property part,testamentary bequest,husband and wife and property contract were issued.
In October of the same year, the personnel affairs part of the Civil Code,donation covering the acquisition of property part, testamentary bequest, husband and wife and property contract were issued.

In October of the same year, the personnel affairs part of the Civil Code, donation covering the acquisition of property part, testamentary bequest, husband and wife and property contract were issued.

sen.j: しかし、「民法出デテ、忠孝亡ブ」との法典論争が巻き起こり、施行が延期される）。
sen.e: Hoever,their implementation were postponed as the legal code dispute saying 'As Civil Code is appearing,loyalty to one's master and filial piety is dying' was stirred up.
sen.cmt: 文末の ） は、無いものと解釈しました。
sen.e: Hoever, implementation was postponed as the legal code dispute read; 'As Civil Code is appearing, loyalty to one's master and filial piety is dying' was stirred up.
However, implementation was postponed as the legal code dispute read; 'As Civil Code is appearing, loyalty to one's master and filial piety is dying' was stirred up.

sen.j: 明治22年（1889年）1月、皇典講究所所長に就任。
sen.e: In January 1889,he assumed as the head of Koten Kokyusho (an research institute for Shinto sect).
In January 1889, he assumed the position as head of Koten Kokyusho (a research institute for the Shinto sect).
In January 1889, he assumed the position as head of Koten Kokyusho (a research institute for the Shinto sect).

sen.j: 同年10月4日、同所内夜間に日本大学（学校法人日本大学の前身）を創設に参加。
sen.e: In October 4 of the same year,he joined to found Nihon University (the predecessor of incorporated educational institution Nihon University) in that place during the night.
On October 4 of the same year, he joined to establish Nihon University (the predecessor of incorporated educational institution Nihon University) in that location during the night.
On October 4 of the same year, he joined to establish Nihon University (the predecessor of incorporated educational institution Nihon University) in that location during the night.

sen.j: 同年12月、第1次山縣内閣の司法大臣就任。
sen.e: In December of the same year,he assumed as Minister of Justice in The First Yamagata Cabinet.
In December of the same year, he assumed the post as Minister of Justice in The First Yamagata Cabinet.
In December of the same year, he assumed the post as Minister of Justice in The First Yamagata Cabinet.

sen.j: 明治23年（1890年）、皇典講究所内に学校法人國學院大學（現・國學院大學）創設。
sen.e: In 1890,he founded incorporated educational institution Kokugakuin University (now Kokugakuin University) in Koten Kokyusho (an research institute for Shinto sect).
In 1890, he established the incorporated educational institution Kokugakuin University (now Kokugakuin University) in Koten Kokyusho (a research institute for the Shinto sect).
In 1890, he established the incorporated educational institution Kokugakuin University (now Kokugakuin University) in Koten Kokyusho.

sen.j: 同年12月、商法施行延期の責任をとって司法大臣を辞任。
sen.e: In December of the same year,he resigned from Minister of Justice,taking a responsibility for the postponement of the Commercial Code implementation.
In December of the same year, he resigned as Minister of Justice, taking responsibility for the postponement of the Commercial Code implementation.
In December of the same year, he resigned as Minister of Justice, taking responsibility for the postponement of the Commercial Code implementation.

sen.j: 明治24年（1891年）2月、司法大臣に復職。
sen.e: In February 1891,he reinstated as Minister of Justice.
In February 1891, he was reinstated as Minister of Justice.
In February 1891, he was reinstated as Minister of Justice.

sen.j: 同年5月、第1次松方内閣の司法大臣に就任。
sen.e: In May of the same year,he assumed as Minister of Justice in The First Matsukata Cabinet.
In May of the same year, he assumed the position as Minister of Justice in The First Matsukata Cabinet.
In May of the same year, he assumed the position as Minister of Justice in The First Matsukata Cabinet.

sen.j: 6月、病気療養を理由に司法大臣を辞任。
sen.e: In June he resigned from Minister of Justice saying he was ailing.
In June he resigned from Ministery of Justice saying he was ailing.
In June he resigned from Ministery of Justice saying he was ailing.

sen.j: 実情は大津事件で犯人を死刑に処せとの明治天皇の指示に副えなかった責任をとっての辞任であった。
sen.e: In fact,it was because he took a responsibility for not having obeyed the order of Emperor Meiji to execute the perpetrator in Otsu Incident.
The fact was because he took responsibility for not having obeyed the orders of Emperor Meiji to execute the perpetrator in the Otsu Incident.
The fact was because he took responsibility for not having obeyed the orders of Emperor Meiji to execute the perpetrator in the Otsu Incident.

sen.j: 以後、翌年まで三崎の別荘などで療養と謹慎の生活を送る。
sen.e: After that,he spend his days in medical treatment and house arrest in his villa in Misaki and others until the following year.
After that, he spent his days in medical treatment and house arrest in his villa in Misaki amongst others until the following year.
After that, he spent his days in medical treatment and house arrest in his villa in Misaki amongst others until the following year.

sen.j: 明治25年（1892年）1月、枢密顧問官に就任。
sen.e: In January 1892,he assumed as Privy Councilor.
In January 1892, he assumed the post as Privy Councilor.
In January 1892, he assumed the post as Privy Councilor.

sen.j: 同年11月、但馬・生野銀山（兵庫県朝来郡生野町）を視察中に突然卒倒し、そのまま立てずに死去。
sen.e: In November of the same year,he fell unconscious suddenly while inspecting Tajima Ikuno Silver Mine (Ikuno town Asago gun Hyogo Prefecture and died without standing up again.
In November of the same year, he fell unconscious suddenly while inspecting Tajima Ikuno Silver Mine (Ikuno town Asago gun Hyogo Prefecture and died.
In November of the same year, he fell unconscious suddenly while inspecting Tajima Ikuno Silver Mine (Ikuno town Asago gun Hyogo Prefecture) and died.

sen.j: 享年49。
sen.e: His age at death was 49.
His age at death was fourty-nine.
His age at death was fourty-nine.

sen.j: 正二位。
sen.e: He was titled Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
His title was Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
His title was Shonii (Senior Second Rank).

sen.j: 勲一等旭日桐花大綬章。
sen.e: He was awarded Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun with Paulownia Flower.
He was awarded Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun with Paulownia Flower.
He was awarded Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun with Paulownia Flower.

sen.j: 法名は顕忠院殿釈義宣空斎大居士。
sen.e: His homyo (a posthumous Buddhist name used in the Shin sect) is KenchuinDenshakuYoshinobuKuusaiDaikoji.
sen.cmt: 義宣空斎→YoshinobuKuusai（定訳不明,該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした。）
sen.e: His homyo (a posthumous Buddhist name used in the Shin sect) is Kenchuin Denshaku Yoshinobu Kuusai Daikoji.
His homyo (a posthumous Buddhist name used in the Shin sect) is Kenchuin Denshaku Yoshinobu Kusai Daikoji.

sen.j: 葬儀は母鶴子により仏葬で営まれたが、本人は生前から神葬を希望していた。
sen.e: His funeral ceremony was done with Buddhist rites but he preferred Shinto style while he lived.
His funeral ceremony was carried out with Buddhist rites, but he preferred Shinto style while he lived.
His funeral ceremony was carried out with Buddhist rites, but he preferred Shinto style while he lived.

sen.j: それを汲んでか、皇典講究所の有志によって「皇典講究所葬」として神式の葬送も行われた。
sen.e: Taking that into consideration,his funeral was also carried out with Shinto rites by volunteers of Koten Kokyusho (an research institute for Shinto sect) as 'Koten Kokyusho funeral'.
Taking that into consideration, his funeral was also carried out with Shinto rites by volunteers of Koten Kokyusho (an research institute for Shinto sect) as 'Koten Kokyusho funeral'.
Taking that into consideration, his funeral was also carried out with Shinto rites by volunteers of Koten Kokyusho as 'Koten Kokyusho funeral'.

sen.j: 墓所は東京都文京区大塚 (文京区)の護国寺（日本大学豊山高校所在地）にある。
sen.e: His graveyard is at Gokoku-ji Temple (the location of Nihon University Buzan high school) in Ootsuka Bunkyo-ku Ward Tokyo (Bunkyo-ku Ward).
His grave is at Gokoku-ji Temple (the location of Nihon University Buzan high school) in Ootsuka Bunkyo-ku Ward Tokyo (Bunkyo-ku Ward).
His grave is at Gokoku-ji Temple (the location of Nihon University Buzan high school) in Ootsuka Bunkyo-ku Ward Tokyo (Bunkyo-ku Ward).

sen.j: 昭和54年（1979年）、日本大学が建学90周年を記念し山口県萩市の誕生地に「顕義園」が設けられた。
sen.e: In 1979, 'Akiyoshi Park' was founded at his birth place in Hagi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture by Nihon University in commemoration of its 90th anniversary.
In 1979, 'Akiyoshi Park' was founded at his birth place in Hagi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture by Nihon University in commemoration of its ninetieth anniversary.
In 1979, 'Akiyoshi Park' was founded at his birth place in Hagi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture by Nihon University in commemoration of its ninetieth anniversary.

sen.j: 園内には「山田顕義先生之像」などが設けられている。
sen.e: the statue of master Akiyoshi YAMADA' was built in the park.
a statue of master Akiyoshi YAMADA' was built in the park.
A statue of master Akiyoshi YAMADA' was built in the park.

sen.j: 長男の夭折後、甥の久雄が選定相続人となって伯爵位を継ぐが若くして死亡。
sen.e: After his first son's premature death,his nephew Hisao succeeded his title count as a selection heir,but he also died young.
After his first son's premature death, his nephew Hisao succeeded his title of count as the selected heir, but he also died young.
After his first son's premature death, his nephew Hisao succeeded his title of count as the selected heir, but he also died young.

sen.j: これにより、久雄の実父で山田の実弟である河上繁栄夫婦が再び山田家に戻って継承し、三代目伯爵となる。
sen.e: Hanei KAWAKAMI,who was natural father of Hisao and Yamada's own younger brother,returned and succeeded to the Yamadas,becoming the third count.
sen.cmt: 河上繁栄→Hanei KAWAKAMI（定訳不明,該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした。）
sen.e: Hanei KAWAKAMI, who was the natural father of Hisao and Yamada's own younger brother, returned and succeeded to the Yamadas, becoming the third count.
Hanei KAWAKAMI, who was the natural father of Hisao and Yamada's own younger brother, returned and succeeded to the Yamada family, becoming the third count.

sen.j: その後は山田の長女梅子（山田死亡当時6歳。龍子が養育）が成人後、会津松平家より、松平容保の三男松平英夫を婿取った。
sen.e: After Yamada's first daughter Umeko (who was 6 at the time of his death.
After Yamada's first daughter Umeko (who was six at the time of his death.

After Yamada's first daughter Umeko (who was six at the time of his death. Brought up by Tastuko) when she came of age, Hideo MATSUDAIRA, the third son of Katamori MATSUDAIRA, was taken for her husband from the Aizu-Matsudaira family.
sen.cmt: 後列と結合しました。原文も結合しました。

sen.j: なお、薩摩治郎八の妻千代子は山田の孫娘にあたる。
sen.e: Chiyoko,Jirohachi SATSUMA's wife,was Yamada's granddaughter.
Chiyoko, Jirohachi SATSUMA's wife, was Yamada's granddaughter.
OK

sen.j: 曾孫にあたる顕喜は日本大学芸術学部映画学科で教授を務めている。
sen.e: His grandson Akinobu in professor at Nihon University, College of Art Department of Cinema.
His grandson Akinobu is a professor at Nihon University, College of Art Department of Cinema.
OK
